;Some people like to talk about "patriarchy and capitalism" and connect "patriarchy" and "capitalism" At the same time, it is actually very inaccurate. This concept is similar to the term "feudal autocracy" because logically speaking, since it is feudal, it is obvious that it cannot be "autocratic". And "autocracy" cannot be feudal. Similarly, if there really is "paternal authority", that is, the kind of powerful patriarch that many people imagine, who can strictly control their children, then the children will naturally not be able to freely enter big cities to work. And under the conditions of capital and free markets, it is actually very easy for a woman or man to get rid of "patriarchy" and enter a big city as a free atomic individual to work in a company cubicle.

;

;"Patriarchy" and "capital" are contradictory

;

;In other words, it is precisely the free market, "capital" and modern enterprises that allow a large number of women/men to become "independent workers" female/male” rather than continuing to obey traditional “patriarchal” dictates. In fact, if you think about it for a moment, if you are a traditional "father" who cares very much about your authority over your children, and you see your children running to work in the markets of big cities and breaking away from your authority, will you applaud or applaud? Will be very angry?

;

;Obviously, capital and market economy are exactly what dismantle "patriarchy", at least for most ordinary people. In traditional "patriarchal" societies, people's lives are dominated by mutual assistance and division of labor in small agricultural communities, and they need to respect family authority and various authoritative customs. However, in the market economy lifestyle, all other needs besides work can be obtained through commercial purchases. A modern independent woman/man can live alone without buying food to cook, order takeout when hungry, and shop at will online. Just live a happy life.

;

;The highly developed living conditions of modern market economy will of course bring about new problems, such as atomized lifestyle, the collapse of family values, the low fertility rate in big cities, etc. But in any case, it is absurd to bring "patriarchy" and "capital" together, because the two are precisely contradictory. "Patriarchy" feels that with the rise of "capital" and the market, their children have gone to big cities, and their authority has collapsed. In "capital", everyone is a customer. I don't care whether your customer wants to be a "patriarch" or an "independent woman/man". Anyway, as long as you pay, I will provide you with products and services.

;

;The free market is an accelerator

;

;Hayek said that in the capital market, every purchase by customers and consumers is a vote, and the market produces the products that best satisfy their needs. A company, brand or business model that customers want. Ordinary people who were destined to have a humble status in pre-modern society have become owners with the ability to vote in the era of capital markets. This is an important progress. Hayek's judgment is very correct. Under capital and market conditions, if a woman/man wants to be a "modern independent woman/man", it will be too late for "capital" to please him and will tend to cater to all the life he likes. way to provide a variety of business services that he prefers. In order to cater to traffic, self-media will also be happy to produce various articles that "modern independent women/men" like to read. To a certain extent, it is precisely in order to cater to customers that "capital" is happy to produce text products such as "Patriarchy and Capitalism" that customers like to read.

;

;This is a paradox, but the logic of "capital" is indeed the same. Capital will provide whatever customers need. In other words, "capital" itself is neutral and does not matter good or evil. The products it embodies represent the interests of the customer group. As for the consequences after customers enjoy these products, "capital" does not care.

;

;For a severely obese junk food lover, "capital" can provide him with a large amount of cheap junk food and "Fat House Happy Water" because this is the demand of customers. For a person who is interested in weight loss and fitness and has strong willpower, "capital" can develop various commercial services for weight loss and fitness, and help this customer achieve a satisfactory body shape. If a person is keen on watching soap operas or playing games, "capital" can provide such nipple entertainment in large quantities at low prices and high quality, and its entertainment effect is unmatched by any pre-modern era. And if a person wants to read high-end classical works, gold inscriptions and silk scrolls, ancient Greek, and Latin, "capital" will also provide them with relevant commercial services, and the price is cheaper than at any time in pre-modern times, and it can be obtained more easily. universal.

;

;In other words, "capital" does not care about the value dimension at all. It is neutral and provides whatever customers need. "Patriarchy" and "modern independent women/men" are all value dimensions. Whether a person wants to indulge in fat house happy water or lose weight and keep fit, "capital" can provide services. In other words, "capital" is just a huge, efficient accelerator that helps people get what they need more efficiently.

;

;Everyone pays for their own preferences

;

;But the results of these options are paid by the customers themselves, and "capital" is not responsible for the consequences of these choices. As a species of Homo sapiens, many of our "personal hobbies" are actually just natural instincts that have been engraved into our genes for 200,000 years of lifestyle, and are not as "personal" and individual as we imagined.

;

;Many people like pets. The images of pets with chubby round faces and big eyes are actually the closest thing to human infants and young children. In the evolutionary path of Homo sapiens for 200,000 years, this preference for chubby, round faces and big eyes has been engraved into the genes. In pre-modern societies, this was natural. It’s only in modern big cities and with the emergence of new cultures that people have the conditions to deceive this long-term instinct. At this time, "capital" can provide services, such as various pet markets, cute animal industry chains, and cute animal subcultures. As long as customers demand it, "capital" will continue to provide these services.

;

;Fat House Happy Water, high-sugar and high-oil snacks, etc., the love for sweetness and fat is also an ancient instinct in the long process of evolution and is engraved in genes. It's just that the body of Homo sapiens never dreamed that the industrial revolution would produce a huge amount of high-carbohydrate food, and it was not adapted to the two, so it often resulted in "fat homes". "Capital" effectively satisfies this primitive love for carbohydrates and fats, and "fat house" has therefore become a way of life in big cities. The killings and wars in video games are actually the elements that Homo sapiens have been most familiar with for 200,000 years and have been engraved in their genetic instincts, that is, wars or hunting between tribes.

;

;In addition, due to the increased threshold after entering big cities and modern life, for example, in the past, a woman might see Zhang San, a young man who was strong and good-looking in the village, and he was an ideal candidate. . But in modern big cities and lifestyles, all kinds of movies, TV shows, advertisements, and short videos are full of handsome Obamas, and the threshold has been greatly increased. So "capital" provides idol dramas, that is to say, "capital" can very efficiently get people's needs. As for the results after customers get it, "capital" doesn't care.

;

;The developed capital markets and commerce in modern big cities can completely separate people from small communities such as traditional families and rural areas, and lead a very atomized home-boy and home-girl life. In terms of comfort, this kind of atomized urban individual is relatively comfortable, although it will be accompanied by some problems. Then which lifestyle to choose can be freely chosen based on different people's time preferences, and "capital" will help them get the content they choose faster. Of course, the lifestyle in modern big cities will also have "capital" to produce related culture to argue that the atomized lifestyle is advanced and free.

;

;Some people stand in a position of sympathy and understanding of "patriarchy". From the perspective of conspiracy theory, they feel that this is a "capital conspiracy", and even speculate that this is a "transnational XX capital conspiracy", which is to be dismantled. Family and childbearing culture. Objectively speaking, this conspiracy theory is absurd, and no secret group could devise such a conspiracy. This big city phenomenon is actually determined by the neutral force of "capital" itself. This also shows that since it is "capital", it is impossible to be "patriarchal".

;

;Conclusion

;

;"Capital" is a neutral accelerator, so in this era, groups who choose different values ​​and lifestyles will get the results of their choice more efficiently.

;

;Some family businesses in the southeast region attach great importance to traditional family values ​​and maintain a relatively good fertility culture. Of course, when doing business with foreign countries, it doesn’t matter what the customers want. But earning money from customers can help the reproduction of your family. In other words, business and your own life are two different things.

;

;Modern developed capital and free markets actually give people more diversified and free choices. If an otaku is willing to choose "Happy Water" and play a successful hero in an online game, that is It's your choice, just bear the consequences of your choice.

;

;It is precisely "capital" that allows more people to have a variety of choices and live an atomic and individual free life that the ancestors of Homo sapiens never dared to imagine for 200,000 years, with almost no restrictions. constraints of traditional community ties. Therefore, it is absurd to associate “capital” with “patriarchy”.

;

;On September 17, 2023, villagers in Zhuozhou, Hebei Province received disaster relief materials donated by all walks of life. (Visual China/Photo)

;

;When floods besieged Zhuozhou, Xinfadi Dashiqiao Wholesale Market was the hardest hit area. More than a month has passed, and the smell of rotten protein and slightly sweet fermentation that once permeated the market has dissipated. The wind blows, raising the dust that the remaining silt has dried up, leaving only a smell of earth.

;

;When the floods first receded, only mud was left in Xiu Mingyu’s shop, an auto parts dealer. There were yellow water stains on the walls and several large cabinets. Nishui Yinzi's loss of auto parts is roughly estimated at 300,000 yuan - on a good day, her annual income is only around 100,000 yuan.

;

;The most terrible thing is that in April 2023, Xiu Mingyu had just paid the arrears of store rent, which she had to borrow 100,000 yuan from a friend. Qi. The lease expires in April next year. If the store cannot reopen, the rent will be in vain.

;

;In late July and early August 2023, extreme heavy rains swept across the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei region, causing floods in many places in Beijing and Hebei. Among them, the people who are most affected by floods are the people living around Beijing.

;

;On weekdays, the prosperity of Beijing seems to be within reach. But when disaster strikes, the test they face becomes even more severe. In October 2023, when there were no traces of floods in the core urban areas of Beijing, they were still working hard to rebuild their lives.

;

;;

;

;September 13, 2023, Xinfadi Dashiqiao Agricultural Products Wholesale Market in Zhuozhou, Hebei Province. (Southern Weekend reporter Jiang Bowen/Photo)

;

;“How much business can compensate for losses?”

;

;Both rented cooked food at Dashiqiao Wholesale Market Lin Fenyi, who works at the stall, did not work up the courage until August 8 to go to her cooked food processing factory in Congyuan Village, Zhuozhou City to see the aftermath of the disaster: four cold storages had holes ripped open by water, maggots were crawling on the rotten meat, and the air was filled with It was filled with a stench that reached straight to the Tianling Cap. She wiped away tears on the spot.

;

;After wiping away the tears, the factory was still saved. Lin Fenyi spent 40,000 yuan to hire a forklift to shovel mud, but it turned out that she could not drive into the factory. She took a big shovel and used human power to push the mud out of the factory door little by little, and then the forklift shoveled it to the roadside. The rotting meat was dug and buried in pits. When the pits were filled, the carrion was piled on the road, and the village sent people to push it off the field. Xiu Mingyu was also very busy trying to reopen the store. For a month, she went to the shop at 8 a.m. every morning to wash and wash her hands, and worked until 7 p.m. at night.

;

;On September 1st, the store reopened, with white walls and shelves full of new products, giving it the appearance of a new life. But the troubles kept coming one after another. The new container I bought for several thousand yuan soon swelled due to the moisture in the store.

;

;Xiu Mingyu is in urgent need of funds. She received a call from someone claiming to be a bank employee, asking if she needed a loan. The store's goods were short of 80,000 to 100,000 yuan, but she couldn't trust the private number calling from Liaoning.  

;

;Business is also deserted. Xiu Mingyu guessed that her store was on a low ground, and after the flood, no one would dare to go to the store to buy anything when it rained. However, even if the customer flow remains the same, "How much business can compensate for these losses?"

;

;When the flood just passed, she was not sure about post-disaster livelihood. A month later, she was already a little calm. She felt comfortable earning a small amount of money in the store. As long as she wanted to open up, she could make do with it.

;

;After spending 300,000 yuan, Lin Fenyi's factory also resumed production in mid-September. She desperately tried to make up for the losses of the past month or so. During the factory shutdown, some old customers turned to other manufacturers to place orders. For this reason, she thought of a "ruthless move": "People sell pig head meat in the market now, and half a catty sells for 12 yuan, so I have to sell it for 11...I won't make a penny, dragging my former customers. Don't drag customers." , you have no transaction."

;

;The transaction is open, but the "pulse" is still very weak. Before the disaster, Lin Fenyi pledged 1 million yuan on the goods and spent another 1 million yuan on expanding the factory. She said there was almost "no money" on the books. After work resumed, she had to lay off only three or four workers; condensing machines , sausage filling machines and other machines were all scrapped, and there was no money to replace them. After three days of resumption of production, the shipment volume was only one ton, which was one-sixth of the original maximum production capacity.

;

;Debts accumulated quickly. In addition to the hundreds of thousands of yuan she borrowed to expand the factory, she also owes money to various suppliers. One of the pig trotters suppliers, who owed more than 10,000 yuan, came to collect payment several times and was "really getting worried." Lin Fenyi showed the other party screenshots of her WeChat balance. One time it was a few hundred yuan, and another time it was just over a thousand yuan. "It's not enough for my children to go to school and buy things."

;

;In Xitan Village, Zhuozhou City, Du Huanying, who runs a nursing home in partnership with Yan Cheng, is also in a similar predicament.

;

;The nursing home covers an area of ​​5 acres and has more than 60 rooms. Du Huanying remembered that before the flood came, the government moved 58 elderly people in the nursing home to another nursing home in the city in advance because the nursing home was located on a low ground. By August 7, 6 elderly people had been picked up by their family members, and 2 elderly people had passed away.

;

;After borrowing 500,000 yuan to invest, Du Huanying's nursing home partially resumed operations. On the afternoon of September 15, the nursing home was filled with iron frame beds that had been moved out, and Du Huanying was wiping the rust spots on the bed. She said that the elderly people who had been temporarily moved out had been moved back into their homes, but the economic losses exceeded one million yuan.

;

;;

;

;September 2023, Du Huanying’s nursing home in Zhuozhou, Hebei. (Southern Weekend reporter Jiang Bowen/Photo)

;

;According to the Hebei Provincial Local Financial Supervision and Administration Bureau, as of August 23, Zhuozhou City’s financial institutions had visited a total of 1,584 matching companies. households, with loans of 108.905 million yuan issued; the city's rural housing insurance has prepaid 26,960 households, a total of 80.88 million yuan; planting insurance has prepaid 105,300 acres, a total of 52.6222 million yuan; breeding insurance has prepaid 11,644 heads, a total of 17.1295 million yuan; Vehicle insurance has paid out compensation for 10,157 vehicles, up to 658 million yuan.

;

;According to CCTV, after the disaster, 14 counties (cities, districts) in Baoding provided counterpart support to 11 towns in Zhuozhou. By the beginning of October, a total of 28 construction teams with 1,040 people from outside Zhuozhou had helped the affected people repair their houses. In addition, the total number of flooded houses in Zhuozhou City is 54,323. Excluding those who are not willing to rebuild, the total number of restoration and reconstruction tasks is 52,843, and 46,706 have been completed. All 124 dilapidated and collapsed buildings that need to be completed in 2023 have started construction, and people's production and living order is being restored at an accelerated pace.

;

;Life around Beijing

;

;Beijing has a complex meaning for Xiu Mingyu. Today, many of her customers are car owners commuting between Beijing and Zhuozhou. But she once had to leave Beijing.

;

;More than 20 years ago, Xiu Mingyu left his hometown in Henan and went to Beijing. He started as a supermarket salesperson with a monthly salary of 400 yuan, and his husband learned to do auto repair.

;

;The couple's life has always been tight. After deducting living expenses from their salary, there is not much money left. In 2009, a child was born, and life became even less affluent. A family of three lived in an urban village in Haidian District.

;

;After working in a supermarket for seven or eight years, in 2014, Xiu Mingyu decided to open an auto parts store with her husband. A year later, the couple moved to Shijingshan District on the outskirts of Beijing.

;

;The store was still being renovated, and the two received a clearance notice again. Now recalling the experience of being forced to move twice, Xiu Mingyu is glad that when she left Shijingshan, at least the local government compensated her for the cost.

;

;Lin Fenyi also worked as a North Piao. When she was sixteen or seventeen, she left her hometown in Heilongjiang and went to Beijing to sell clothes, where she met her husband, who was a construction worker at the time. In 2004, the two got married and returned to their husband's hometown in Zhuozhou.

;

;When I first returned to Zhuozhou, life was not easy. Lin Fenyi remembers that when she was in confinement after giving birth to her daughter, her husband’s old house still had cracks in it. Her father did not dare to come see her. After his brother came, he asked: "Sister, how can you find such a poor person? How can you live in such a house?" He introduced his sister to a way out, making cooked food, "It's better to do some small business." It’s better than working for someone else.” The couple slowly started a cooked food business.

;

;Yan Cheng didn’t have to leave his hometown. He prides himself on being "very smart". In a township in Zhuanghe City, Liaoning Province, he learned to be a doctor and carpenter at the age of 17, drove a large truck, ran an oil mill, a wood processing factory, and worked as an agricultural machinery station. Webmaster. After struggling for more than ten years, his hometown was about to be flooded due to the construction of a reservoir. He became a "reservoir immigrant" and went to Zhuozhou to live with his relatives in 2000.

;

;When he arrived in Zhuozhou, Yan Cheng also struggled a lot. He once ran an auto repair shop and earned 300,000 yuan a year. However, he had to close down due to an accident in 2008. In 2015, he joined Du Huanying's nursing home.

;

;Nursing homes are not a profitable business. Du Huanying said that their fees are not high to begin with, but special groups who encounter family difficulties only charge cost. The hospital only earns 150,000 yuan a year, but the investment is huge. Initially, the two spent 2.8 million yuan building a courtyard for more than 40 elderly people. Later, a local official suggested that they expand, so they spent more than 2 million yuan to expand a second courtyard in 2019.

;

;The second courtyard had just been completed when it encountered an epidemic. The nursing home is under closed management and cannot admit new elderly people. Yan Cheng's son-in-law said that during the epidemic, they did not ask the elderly family members to pay for various medicines. "It has not been easy to make money for three years during the epidemic."

;

;In Lin Fenyi's eyes, her business has not been making money for a long time. In the beginning, she and her husband knew nothing, so they could only throw in three to five thousand yuan to accumulate experience. If a batch of goods was broken, they would throw it away and replace it with another batch.

;

;This line is dirty and tiring. When stewing pig heads, work starts at 5 a.m. and the pig heads are shaved first. This work makes people covered in oil. Afterwards, the brains are cut open, and the pig head divided into two sections is boiled in a pot. After cooking, the bones and meat are separated, washed, bagged, and put in the cold storage to freeze. The work can only be finished at eight or nine in the evening. There is no heating in the winter. The place - about ten years ago, my husband's old house was demolished, and the family had to live in the factory bungalow.

;

;;

;

;September 13, 2023, Linfen Yijia’s factory in Zhuozhou, Hebei. (Southern Weekend reporter Jiang Bowen/Photo)

;

;After so many years, their lives are finally on the right track: Xiu Mingyu opened a shop, bought a house, and settled down in Zhuozhou. The fate of being constantly exiled seems to have come to an end; Yan Cheng and Du Huanying's nursing home survived the epidemic, and even elderly people from Beijing came to stay there; Lin Fenyi's factory gradually made money, hired workers, and her husband took care of it. When it comes to purchasing goods, she is in charge of sales, and the cooked food is sold to Beijing.

;

;Until the flood hit.

;

;Yan Cheng is 64 years old and cannot retire yet. "I have to help her (Du Huanying). If I don't, she will fall down immediately." The cost of building a nursing home is still nearly 4 million yuan, and new debts have been incurred after the flood. This old man, who had been swallowed by water twice in his life, decided to work for a few more years.

;

;The missing son, the deceased wife

;

;The son Ma Lihua disappeared in the mudslide more than two months ago.

;

;Initially, Ma Xianlin, a villager in Tangjiazhuang Village, Laishui County, pinned his hope of finding his son on an excavator. By mid-September, he had no choice but to give up.

;

;21-year-old Ma Lihua is a student majoring in imaging medicine and will just graduate in the summer of 2023. He was supposed to have a life slowly unfolding in Beijing.

;

;Tangjiazhuang Village is one of the villages severely affected by this round of heavy rains and floods. On July 31, Ma Xianlin narrowly escaped from the mudslide that poured into the yard, but Ma Lihua was nowhere to be seen.

;

;The son should have walked out of this mountain. When she was a child, Ma Lihua occasionally said she didn't want to study anymore, and Ma Xianlin would always show up and give her own account: He dropped out of elementary school in the third grade and was uneducated, so he had to work in a coal mine. Earning money was difficult and dangerous. So, my son returned to school obediently.

;

;This summer, Ma Lihua just completed more than nine months of hospital internship and graduated from a college in Tangshan. During the summer, he was learning to drive while planning for the future.

;

;Ma Xianlin said that a relative in Zhuolu County once wanted to introduce his son to a job in a small hospital, but he refused and insisted on going to Beijing. My sister, who has been a fitness instructor in Beijing for 10 years, also wants to take her younger brother with her. If she can't go to a big hospital, she goes to a small clinic. She remembered that her brother once asked her if she wanted to go outside to practice. She replied decisively, "Just stay by my side."

;

;Now, the day when siblings get together may never come.

;

;This is not the first time that 65-year-old Ma Xianlin has lost a close relative. When he was 12 years old, his father was hit in the head by a falling stone while working in the production team. He died before he could be carried to the hospital. The mother was so anxious about her husband's death that she lost her sight. A few years later, several of Ma Xianlin's sisters got married and left home, leaving him and his mother alone in the family.

;

;It wasn't until he was in his thirties that Ma Xianlin married a wife and had someone to take care of his mother, so he was able to go out to work. In Hebei, he worked in private coal mines and also paved roads and built walls. Four years ago, Ma Xianlin got old and couldn't move big rocks, so he bought 30 sheep and started herding them in his hometown.

;

;The flock continues to multiply. In 2022, Ma Xianlin sold 48 lambs for 20,000 to 30,000 yuan. By this year, he already had 160 sheep. Based on the calculation of 700 yuan for a lamb and 1,400 yuan for an adult sheep, this will be a good income.

;

;Unexpectedly, in a mudslide, nearly half of the sheep disappeared. For more than a month after the disaster, he went up the mountain every day to look for sheep, but he harvested very little. He had a bone spur in his leg and had to take medicine every day to treat the leg pain. He had to walk up and down the mountains to herd and find sheep, which was unbearable for him.

;

;"I am getting older and my younger (children) are gone." In the end, he made up his mind to sell all the sheep after autumn. On September 12, when asked about his future livelihood, Ma Xianlin remained silent.

;

;On October 15, Southern Weekend reporters contacted Ma Xianlin again, hoping to learn about the progress of his search for his son. He didn't answer.

;

;Thirty kilometers away in Xiamingyu Village, Laishui County, 67-year-old villager Pang Shenggong also lost his loved ones in flash floods and mudslides on July 31. His wife was swept away by the current, and the family searched for seven or eight miles but could not find her. Later, someone found her body 70 to 80 kilometers away from her home and brought her back to the village for burial.

;

;;

;

;On August 12, 2023, Xiamingyu Village, Laishui County, Hebei Province. (Southern Weekend reporter Jiang Bowen/Photo)

;

;When he met the Southern Weekend reporter on September 15, Pang Shenggong was no longer willing to mention this sad incident. He had just come out of the mountains, wearing a bamboo hat and his clothes were no longer messy - a month ago, he was covered in mud when cleaning up the washed-out house, and his trousers were only tied with a cloth belt.

;

;In his impression, his wife has a cheerful personality and likes to dance in the village yangko team. But three years ago, my wife had a fall. After the operation, her body was not as good as before, and she could not walk on the aisle. "I can't leave you for a while," Pang Shenggong said.

;

;It is not easy to make a living while being chained to your home. Since the 1980s, Pang Shenggong has been working outside the home and often goes to Beijing. He worked in the coal mines of Fangshan District to dig coal and build railways. He continued to work until he was in his fifties. In order to take care of his children and go to school, he gradually stopped going out and worked small jobs in the village.

;

;After his wife's surgery, Pang Shenggong never worked as a minor worker again. Fortunately, the younger son is moving goods in a warehouse in Gu'an County, Langfang City, so he can supplement Pang Shenggong's monthly salary of three to four thousand yuan.

;

;Now, Pang Shenggong has moved into the temporarily unused house of the third brother in the east of the village, and is ready to live a hard life. "How much money do you have to spend?" His voice gradually faded.

;

;According to Hebei Daily, on September 22, the first batch of post-disaster reconstruction projects in Laishui County have started intensively, with a total investment of 185 million yuan, including river cleaning The siltation project, four bridge reconstruction projects and the first batch of post-disaster power distribution network reconstruction projects will be completed before the 2024 flood season.

;

;Villages in the suburbs of Beijing heal the wounds

;

;In the suburbs of Beijing, mountains separate the villages from the prosperity . A flood passed through and the force of nature tore the village apart.

;

;In Cijiajia Village, Fangshan District, according to villager Liu Huazao, there were originally one or two thousand people living in the village. An entire street in the south was seriously damaged by the flood. About one to two hundred people were temporarily relocated.

;

;On September 27, Liu Huazao's father went to Tongren Hospital for eye laser treatment. Some time ago, he always felt like mosquitoes were flying in front of his eyes. After checking, he found out that the vitreous body had fallen off. Liu Huazao felt that this was caused by his father being upset and having severe high blood pressure after the flood.

;

;At around 10 a.m. on July 31, when the water rose the most, the Liu family and their neighbors climbed onto the roof to escape Shen Da. 1.7 meters of water. That night, the water came up again, leaving a second water line about 1 meter high in the house.

;

;But favor is slowly closing some wounds.

;

;After the water receded, Liu Huazao felt "it's good to be alive." The villagers who had survived the disaster met and said to each other, "Just live, don't talk about anything else."

;

;The relatives are closer. One after another, relatives outside the country reached out to help Liu Huazao's family, "giving them some money." The disaster-stricken family even lacked clothes and cooking utensils.

;

;The neighbors suddenly have a "life-changing" friendship. In the past, Liu Huazao didn't move around very frequently with the villagers, just "meet and say hello." But he felt that the moments of life and death in the water inspired goodwill in people's hearts. On the day the family hid on the roof, a neighbor in the front yard helped hold Liu Huazao's daughter. After the disaster, the villagers helped each other. When the silt in their own homes was almost cleared, they would be cleared by others. Elderly people in the village who had children in other places would ask them what shortcomings there were in their homes.

;

;Liu Huazao remembered that before the water supply in the village was restored, a group of young people organized water trucks to deliver water for washing to the villagers. For four or five days, they stopped the car at the entrance of the alley and called the villagers to get water.

;

;Zhu Xiu, who opened a supermarket in the village, witnessed the complexity of human beings in the flood. Five to six thousand yuan in cash was taken away from the supermarket by water, but she only got back more than one thousand yuan. She heard that someone found money, but she didn't know if it was lost by her family and couldn't ask for it. She also heard that many people picked up the wine that was washed away from her home, but very little was returned. Only one bottle of 10 bottles of liquor worth more than 1,000 yuan was returned.

;

;However, Zhu Xiu did not feel resentful about this. "If you lose it, it's not like someone stole it from you. Whoever picked it up belongs to the one who picked it up... We just accept that we are unlucky."

;

;Zhu Xiuye I thought maybe insurance would pay some compensation. Last year, she took out an insurance policy in a daze. After the disaster, someone from the insurance company came and told her that the insurance was not for property, but for people. Zhu Xiu, who couldn't even find the contract, had no choice but to accept it.

;

;But she also discovered the kindness between people. A winery promised to replace her damaged wine for free, and relatives and friends provided money, food, and pots and pans after the disaster.

;

;Among the supporters, many, like Zhu Xiu, are migrant workers in Beijing. "There is a feeling of closeness... Being so far away from my hometown makes me feel that we can understand each other." She remembered that about 20 years ago, she and her husband first settled in Cijijiao, and later more foreigners came. Work in the village. Some migrant workers had no money left after buying tickets to Beijing, no place to sleep, and no food to eat. It was she who made noodles and steamed buns and spread bedding in the rented room to provide food and accommodation for them. When those who couldn't find a job had to leave, she would give them travel expenses. Now, it seems that goodwill from the past has been repaid.

;

;;

;

;September 27, 2023, Cijiajia Village, Fangshan District, Beijing. (Southern Weekend reporter Jiang Bowen/Photo)

;

;According to Beijing Daily, on the morning of August 27, Fangshan District held a post-disaster reconstruction swearing-in meeting at Sandu Bridge. The overall goal of reconstruction is "basic recovery in one year, comprehensive improvement in three years, and long-term high-quality development."

;

;Zhao Xiuli, chief of the Planning and Urban Design Section of the Fangshan District Planning and Nature Commission, said in an interview with CCTV that according to Beijing's unified standards, for collapsed buildings It is recommended that dilapidated houses be demolished and rebuilt. Each house will be compensated at a rate of 95,000 yuan. For repairable houses, a repair compensation of 30,000 yuan will be given, and low-income households will receive double compensation. For houses that are uninhabitable, each person will be paid a total of 3,960 yuan for three months. rental subsidy. In addition, each person is provided with a living allowance of 660 yuan. Staff from the Fangshan District Housing and Urban-Rural Development Committee said that repair compensation of 30,000 yuan has been gradually distributed.

;

;“I have to stand up no matter what”

;

;In the villagers’ accounts, the flood was not the first change that Ci’s housework had experienced. , this once prosperous village has been in decline for many years.

;

;Liu Huazao remembers that the household chores thirty years ago were more generous than they are now. At that time, there was a dragon dance lantern show, a two-story shopping mall and a movie theater. What supports these are the workers in the surrounding coal mines and cement plants.

;

;Zhu Xiu's husband is one of them. More than 20 years ago, Zhu Xiu was still farming in her hometown in Anhui, and her life was difficult. When she saw a fellow villager working in Cijiujiu's cement factory, she came with her husband. Her husband followed the car in the factory, and she sold vegetables in the village. . She remembered that there were many migrant workers at that time, and dozens of people could live in a small courtyard in the village.

;

;For the local area, factories and coal mines are a double-edged sword. Liu Huazao still remembers their pollution. When he was a child, there would be gray dust like white flour in the village. On the other hand, although working as a factory and miner does not make much money, it is a job that can make a living at home. Liu Huazao's father had worked in a cement factory in his early years, driving a tractor to transport stones.

;

;Around 2000, cement plants and coal mines were closed down one after another. The pollution is gone, and the livelihood at home is even more cut off. If they want to make a living, villagers can only run to the city.

;

;Zhu Xiu found that the Anhui fellows who worked at Ciji as housekeepers left one after another, but she did not leave. After her husband lost his job at the cement factory, she borrowed money from relatives and friends to open a supermarket in the village. More than ten years ago, a market was built in the village, and people from surrounding towns came to do business. The supermarket was once very prosperous. "Our business used to be the best in this village."

;

;Around 2015, the village ushered in a turning point - demolition. Some villagers chose to move away and wait to move into the resettlement community.

;

;Li Guangnan didn’t leave. The bus driver, who was a farmer, wanted to buy a house for himself, his son and his married daughter, but he failed.

;

;Liu Huazao's family did not leave either. Apart from being dissatisfied with the compensation package, the family has gotten used to life in the village. The small courtyard can enjoy the cool air, and the elderly can grow cucumbers, tomatoes, and eggplants, and save some money.

;

;Not only private houses are being demolished, but around 2019, the market in front of Zhuxiujia Supermarket was also demolished and moved elsewhere. Her business gradually shrank, and the supermarket's annual revenue dropped to two to three million yuan.

;

;Finally, in the summer of 2023, there was a record-breaking flood.

;

;On July 31, villager Li Guangnan ran out with waist-deep water. On August 20, he returned to work at the bus company. More than a month later, his old life seemed to be back, but he knew that order was far from being restored. When he was working as a driver, he earned a monthly salary of nearly 10,000 yuan at most. In 2022, because of his hearing loss, he took a second job and took a cleaning job, so his monthly salary was reduced to 4,000 yuan. In two years, he will retire, and his income will be cut in half. Life may be even more difficult.

;

;Li Guangnan has always been worried about his son. He has worked in both the bus and subway companies, but he didn't last long and was still old. Before the disaster, my son was driving Didi. After the flood washed away the car, he didn't even drive Didi again. At the end of September, when asked whether he wanted to return to his old career, his son only replied: "Maybe."

;

;Liu Huazao's family, who did not want to live in a high-rise building, also faced reality. Compromised. The house had to be rebuilt. Before he raised 600,000 yuan to break ground, Liu Huazao rented a house in a nearby community for a year.

;

;He is most worried about his 5-year-old daughter. Just after the flood, his daughter said to him: "Dad, I was so scared that day." Liu Huazao told her not to be afraid, he would come to save her.

;

;Nearly two months later, Liu Huazao discovered that although her daughter knew that floods would wash away tablets and toys, she still didn’t understand that floods would endanger her life, and she was mentally unstable. Something went terribly wrong.

;

;He is also working hard to escape the shadow of the flood. Liu Huazao knows that he is the backbone of the family, and only by adjusting himself can his family feel relieved. So, he tried hard to find some little surprises for himself: plastic objects can still be used after being rinsed, and some electronic devices can still turn on their screens with a swipe.

;

;Zhu Xiu’s half-life hard work was gone with the water. In mid-September, when she met the Southern Weekend reporter for the second time, she said that she felt quite depressed and couldn't think about it for a while.

;

;But when she met the Southern Weekend reporter for the third time at the end of September, she finally recovered. The store still had to stay open, and she didn't want to cheat the suppliers who agreed to her credit. "You have to stand up and work hard no matter what. You can't just lie down."

;

;She thought that if the business was not going well, she would open a store somewhere else. As for her hometown where she still had three acres of land, Zhu Xiu knew that she would never be able to go back.

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 21:25:05 +0800 20家上市银行中报出炉：信贷投放最多的行业不良率高还是低？http://www.infzm.com/contents/258820
;;2023-10-18 20:00:00;
;

;Changes in bank credit asset quality reflect the pulse of the real economy.

;

;Li Bin, director of the Macro-Prudential Administration Bureau of the People's Bank of China, attended the press conference on financial statistics for the third quarter of 2023 on October 13 and said that as of the end of June, the average non-performing ratio of systemically important banks was 1.27%, maintaining achieve higher asset quality.

;

;Li Bin said that the total assets of systemically important banks account for 61% of the total assets of my country's banking industry and 55% of the total assets of the financial industry. Systemically important banks have relatively high structural and business complexity, and relatively strong correlations with other financial institutions. Therefore, data from systemically important banks better reflects the latest changes in the banking industry and even the macroeconomy.

;

;Currently, 19 of the 20 systemically important banks have been listed on the Shanghai and Shenzhen Stock Exchanges, making them the most fully disclosed group in the banking industry. Since 2023, which industries have the best and worst credit assets of systemically important banks? Which banks have the most effective measures to resolve non-performing assets? Which banks have the most adequate disclosure of information about their non-performing assets?

;

;;

;

;Southern Weekend New For this purpose, researchers from the Financial Research Center conducted a special review and data analysis of the interim reports of the 20 listed banks with the largest assets (including 19 systemically important banks and China Zheshang Bank). The study found that as of the end of June, the total loan balance of 20 listed banks was nearly 150 trillion yuan, accounting for 63.5% of the total loan scale of all financial institutions; the total scale of non-performing loans was approximately 1.92 trillion yuan, accounting for approximately 48% of the total scale of non-performing assets of financial institutions. %, the average non-performing loan ratio is about 1.28%, which is lower than the average non-performing loan ratio of the banking industry of 1.62%, indicating that the credit quality of large and medium-sized commercial banks is better than that of small and medium-sized banks.

;

;;

;

;But the real estate industry , manufacturing and business services industries rank among the top three in terms of non-performing loan size, and the accommodation and catering industry, real estate industry and mining industry have the highest average non-performing loan ratio.

;

;The balance of non-performing credit card loans exceeded that of personal housing loans for the first time in three years, and the non-performing loan rate was 4.2 times higher than that of personal housing loans. Looking at the regional distribution of non-performing loans, the western region has the largest scale of non-performing loans, and the northeastern region has the highest average non-performing loan ratio.

;

;;Large loan size and low NPL ratio;;: ;;Transportation, warehousing and postal industry;

;

;Which Which industry receives the greatest support from bank credit? Are their NPL ratios positively or negatively related to bank support?

;

;Researchers from the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center combed through the interim reports of 20 listed banks and found that each bank disclosed the distribution of corporate loans in 20 major industries.

;

;Manufacturing, leasing and business services, transportation, warehousing and postal services are the three industries with the most credit granted by the 20 listed banks. The total loan balance of the three industries at the end of June exceeded 10 trillion. Yuan. With regulators vigorously promoting the high-quality development of the manufacturing industry, the manufacturing industry has become a credit area that major commercial banks attach great importance to. Among the 20 listed banks, 19 banks rank in the top two in terms of manufacturing investment scale. However, the leasing and business services industry ranks first among the 20 banks’ credit lending industries the most, with 10 companies.

;

;Has the massive increase in industry credit been accompanied by a sharp increase in non-performing loans since then? An analysis by researchers at the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center found that increased credit in some industries is indeed positively related to the growth of non-performing loans. This is especially obvious in the real estate industry. As the credit scale ranks fourth in the industry and the average non-performing rate in the industry ranks second, it has become the industry with the most concentrated credit risks of commercial banks.

;

;;

;

;But 20 The industry distribution of credit granted by listed banks does not completely coincide with the industry distribution of non-performing loans. As of the end of June 2023, the average non-performing ratios of the manufacturing, leasing and business services, transportation, warehousing, and postal industries that provide the most credit are only 1.8%, 1.45%, and 0.64% respectively. The real estate, manufacturing, leasing and business services industries have the highest scale of non-performing loans, with balances of non-performing loans reaching 295.1 billion, 266 billion and 208.8 billion respectively. The total scale is close to 770 billion, accounting for 57% of the non-performing balance of corporate loans. The total non-performing loans 40%. Among them, the transportation, warehousing and postal industry has credit extensions of up to 13.8 trillion yuan, but its non-performing ratio is only 0.64%. It is a typical industry with large loan scale and low non-performing ratio.

;

;;

;

;The study also found , the increase in the scale of credit in a certain industry is not necessarily accompanied by the year-on-year increase in the scale of non-performing loans. For example, compared with the end of 2022, as of the end of June 2023, the manufacturing loan balance has increased by as high as 18.83%, and the loan growth rate is at the forefront of all industries, but its non-performing loan balance has remained the same or even slightly decreased compared with the end of 2022.

;

;;Banks are most willing to lend in the ;;Yangtze River Delta;;;

;

;The intensity of credit support for different industries is differentiated At the same time, in which areas do banks have the greatest differentiation in their countercyclical investments?

;

;Researchers from the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center found that most of the 20 listed banks disclosed the regional distribution of credit and the regional distribution of non-performing loans, but each bank’s regional division method Not the same as above. Among them, the regional distribution rules of six banks, namely Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, Agricultural Bank of China, China Construction Bank, Postal Savings Bank of China, China Merchants Bank and China Minsheng Bank, are completely consistent.

;

;;

;

;Southern Weekend New Researchers from the Financial Research Center analyzed the mid-term reports of the above-mentioned six banks and found that the six banks in the Yangtze River Delta region have the largest credit scale, the highest proportion, the fastest growth rate, and the lowest average non-performing loan ratio. Based on the conclusions of Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center's special survey on Suzhou's financial ecology in April 2023 (see Southern Weekend APP's "Suzhou Financial Ecology In-depth Research Special Topic" for details), researchers from Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center believe that as China's economic engine region , the financial ecology of the Yangtze River Delta region (mainly Shanghai, Jiangsu, and Zhejiang) maintains a leading level in the country. Banks generally want and are willing to lend to the real economy, and the ultra-low non-performing ratio further strengthens the banks' position in the Yangtze River Delta market. Dare to lend, truly lend, and increase confidence in credit extension. Therefore, the Yangtze River Delta region is undoubtedly the area where commercial banks dare to lend the most, and it is also a must-have for the banking industry.

;

;;

;

;Rated system Among the five city commercial banks that are important banks, four are from the Yangtze River Delta region. The asset scale, operating efficiency and asset quality of these city commercial banks are among the best in the industry. This proves that the Yangtze River Delta region has the best financial ecological environment in the country.

;

;Correspondingly, the credit growth rate of the 20 listed banks in the northeastern region (Heilongjiang, Jilin, and Liaoning) is the slowest, the credit proportion continues to shrink, and the non-performing loan ratio is high among all regions in the country. Data shows that large state-owned banks are more determined than joint-stock banks and city commercial banks in implementing the strategic intentions of decision-makers to revitalize the Northeast. The financial support of large state-owned banks to the Northeast is also the mainstay for the stable operation of the financial industry in the Northeast.

;

;;Non-performing personal mortgage loans surged;;The momentum eased;

;

;Although corporate loans are the mainstay of commercial bank credit, personal loan business is becoming increasingly important , especially personal housing loans.

;

;The scale of personal mortgage loans remains the largest among all personal loans of commercial banks, and the non-performing rate has been at the lowest level among all types of loan business for a long time. Therefore, it has become the most valued high-quality asset of commercial banks.

;

;What changes have occurred in the asset quality of personal mortgage loans? In order to facilitate comparisons with the same caliber, researchers from the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center selected 10 banks’ personal mortgage businesses for statistical analysis. These 10 banks include six state-owned commercial banks, Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, Agricultural Bank of China, Bank of China, China Construction Bank, Postal Savings Bank, and Bank of Communications, and four national joint-stock commercial banks, China Merchants Bank, Industrial Bank, Shanghai Pudong Development Bank, and Minsheng Bank. As of the end of 2022, the total scale of personal mortgage loans of 10 banks accounts for 80% of the total scale of personal mortgage loans in the banking industry. Therefore, the personal mortgage business of the 10 banks has strong industry representation.

;

;Research shows that starting from 2022, the growth rate of non-performing loan balances of personal housing loans has increased significantly. At the end of June 2022, the total non-performing balance of personal housing loans of 10 listed banks was 104.871 billion yuan, a sharp increase of 16.8 billion yuan from the end of 2021, with a month-on-month growth rate of 19.1%; in the second half of 2022, the non-performing balance of personal housing loans of 10 listed banks increased again. An increase of 30.4 billion yuan. By the end of 2022, the total balance of non-performing loans has increased to 135.255 billion yuan, a year-on-year growth rate of 53.6%; in the first half of 2023, the balance of non-performing loans has reached 138.629 billion yuan, a year-on-year growth rate of 32.2%, but the month-on-month growth rate is as high as fell back to 2.5%.

;

;;

;

;The second central bank The quarterly monetary policy implementation report shows that at the end of June, the balance of personal housing loans of major financial institutions across the country (including foreign capital) was 38.6 trillion yuan, a year-on-year decrease of 0.7%, and the first year-on-year negative growth.

;

;Affected by the surge in non-performing loan balances and the stagnant growth rate of loan scale that turned negative, the non-performing rate of personal housing loans has increased significantly since 2022. At the end of June 2023, the average non-performing rate of personal housing loans of 10 listed banks was 0.48%, an increase of 0.15 percentage points from the end of 2021, an increase of 45%.

;

;;

;

;Southern Weekend New Researchers from the Financial Research Center believe that despite the rapid growth in the scale and non-performing ratio of personal housing loans, compared with other types of credit, personal housing loans are still high-quality assets of commercial banks and will continue to be an important part of each bank's personal loan business. focus. At the same time, the central bank and other ministries and commissions have successively introduced new housing loan policies and continued to loosen restrictions on the real estate industry. The asset quality of personal housing loan business is expected to stabilize in the future.

;

;;Credit card business;;Facing test;

;

;In addition to personal mortgage business, credit card business is also the strategic focus of commercial banks. How does it perform?

;

;Researchers from the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center comparatively analyzed the interim reports of 13 commercial banks that disclosed the quality of credit card loans and found that the credit card business has seen multiple trend changes since 2022. First, two important indicators recorded negative growth for the first time on record. Among them, at the end of 2022, the cumulative number of credit cards issued was approximately 798 million, showing negative growth for the first time on record; the outstanding credit balance of credit cards was 8.69 trillion yuan, a year-on-year increase of only 0.9%, which was significantly higher than the average annual growth rate of 8% between 2019 and 2021. decline. As of the end of June 2023, the outstanding credit balance of credit cards of 13 listed banks (the scale of credit card business accounts for about 85% of the total scale of the banking industry) was 7.44 trillion yuan, a decrease of about 23 billion yuan from the end of 2022, which was also the first time on record. decline.

;

;;

;

;The second is credit card The quality of business assets is facing tests. As of the end of June 2023, the total non-performing balance of credit card accounts receivable of 13 commercial banks reached 148.2 billion yuan, slightly exceeding personal housing loans with a limit of 4 billion yuan. Following the 2020 interim report, it has once again become the personal loan business with the largest non-performing loan. . Correspondingly, the average non-performing loan ratio of credit card receivables of 13 banks is 2.29%, which is also a new high in the past three years after the 2020 mid-term report.

;

;From 2020 to 2023, the asset quality pressure of commercial banks’ credit card business will increase significantly. Among them, the credit card non-performing loan balance and non-performing loan ratio reached two peaks in June 2020 and June 2023 respectively, with the peak in June 2020 being slightly higher than that in June 2023.

;

;;

;

;Southern Weekend New Researchers from the Financial Research Center further studied the two peaks and found that the peak of credit card non-performing in June 2020 was mainly due to the sudden impact of the epidemic on household and personal balance sheets, superimposed on the factors of untimely repayment caused by restricted movement of people during the epidemic; During the period when the epidemic is calming down, the balance of non-performing loans and non-performing loans of commercial banks' credit cards have tended to fall, but the low point of the decline is still significantly higher than before the epidemic. Since 2023, commercial banks have responded to regulatory requirements and no longer blindly compete for land, but have turned to intensive cultivation and prudent credit extension. The growth of credit card issuance volume, credit scale, unfinished credit scale and other indicators has significantly slowed down or even experienced negative growth. This has also led to a high non-performing rate in credit card business. However, as banks continue to implement prudent strategies, credit card non-performing rates are expected to fall.

;

;;Which banks;; “;;optimize”;; bad disclosures? ;

;

;The two indicators of non-performing loan balance and non-performing ratio are the most important and most sensitive indicators to measure the quality of credit assets. Which commercial banks have the courage to conduct complete and comprehensive information disclosure on the quality of their credit assets?

;

;The comparative study of this item by researchers from the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center is mainly based on whether 20 listed banks disclose information on corporate loans by industry and region, and whether the industry and region of non-performing loans are separately Disclosure: When disclosing the components of personal loans, including personal housing loans, consumer loans, operating loans, and credit card loan balances, proportions, and growth rates, whether the corresponding non-performing loan balances and non-performing ratios are disclosed.

;

;The study found that in terms of the quality of information disclosure on non-performing loans, the level of disclosure of 20 listed banks varied. Large state-owned banks basically disclosed the above information at the same time. Only Bank of China stated "non-performing" as "impairment" in its annual report, which may easily cause certain misunderstandings.

;

;Among the national joint-stock banks, China Merchants Bank has the most complete disclosure of non-performing loans, while other joint-stock banks have more or less "optimized" non-performing loan-related data according to their own needs when disclosing. Typical "optimization" methods include setting personalized "caliber". For example, when disclosing the industry distribution of non-performing loans, some banks do not directly disclose the non-performing loan balance and non-performing ratio data of each industry. However, through other relevant data disclosed by the bank, the distribution of non-performing loans in different industries of the bank can be estimated; For another example, when disclosing the non-performing status of personal housing loans, some banks merged this business with other personal loan businesses with certified mortgages; in addition, when disclosing the regional distribution of non-performing loans, 6 of the 9 joint-stock banks were based on the Yangtze River Delta A total of 6 regions are divided and disclosed, including the Pearl River Delta, the Bohai Rim, the central region, the western region and the northeastern region. However, Ping An Bank and Zheshang Bank divide the country into 4 regions; Industrial Bank divides the country into 4 regions based on geographical regions. The city, province or other important city where the headquarters is located is listed and disclosed separately; individual banks will also fine-tune the provinces under a certain region, making it difficult to make horizontal and vertical comparisons of the regional distribution of the bank's credit.

;

;Some banks disclose weaker asset quality for retail loans than for corporate loans. Among the 20 listed banks, 13 banks directly disclosed or indirectly disclosed the distribution of personal loans in their interim reports. However, extending to 2020 and previous annual reports and interim reports, only about 10 banks disclosed the asset quality of personal loans. As a leading city commercial bank, Bank of Beijing has disclosed neither the industry distribution nor the regional distribution of non-performing loans in its previous annual reports and interim reports. It has disclosed the least asset quality among the 20 listed banks. .

;

;The frequency of mentions of "bad" in financial reports can also be used as an indication of the bank's credit disclosure adequacy in terms of loan quality. Statistics from researchers at Southern Weekend's New Finance Research Center found that China Merchants Bank was mentioned as "non-performing" the most in the 2023 interim report, a total of 94 times, while the Bank of Jiangsu was mentioned the least often, only 19 times.

;

;;

;

;True and accurate , completeness, timeliness and fairness are the principle requirements for the information disclosure of listed companies. Standardization, easy to understand and easy to obtain are the basic requirements for the form of information disclosure of listed companies. According to this, a researcher at the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center believes that listed systemically important banks are the benchmark for China's banking industry and should also be the benchmark for information disclosure in the banking industry. Annual reports and annual reports should be based on various requirements for information disclosure by listed companies. The disclosure of important information such as interim reports is strictly controlled. In particular, indicators related to bank asset quality and their changes have attracted more attention from investors and the public. Listed banks should disclose true, accurate, complete, timely and fair information, and ensure that the disclosed information is standardized. , easy to understand and obtain, and continuously improve the compliance and transparency of corporate governance of listed banks.
